"Bouldergeist" at San Lee Park - Southern Classic
Alray Tire of Boone Cycling Series at NWS
description: This year we race EVERY Wednesday, with five, four-week monthly mini series. At the end of each miniseries, we will award Leaders Jerseys from Capo for every category, that the winners will have to be defended the following month.
course: The Safest Place You\'ll Ever Race. The historic 5/8th mile (1000m) oval features a rising back stretch with a consistent head wind that keeps the racing exciting and rewards good tactics.
registration:
Season pass for unlimited racing only $225 - thats a savings of up to $195! 
Single race $15, $5 for two or more. College and Youth $10.
USAC License required. One-day license $10
ANSI approved helmet must be worn at all times while riding.
Registration opens at 5:00PM. No one is allowed to ride on the track prior to registering. If you arrive before 5:00PM, you MAY be allowed to enter the stadium depending on other track activity. 
Numbers on the left. Save your number for the entire series.
notes:
Prizes awarded three deep at the conclusion of each four race mini-series. First place each category awarded a Capo custom Leader\'s Jersey. Pro Cat 1/2/3/4  \"Open\" race pays $150/5 deep
Master\'s race at 8:00PM will only be offered in the months of June and July
Permit pending under USA Cycling.
directions:
From Boone, NC-18 (Lenoir, Hickory and Ashevllle) and points West:

Take US HWY 421 S to Exit 282

Left at on Statesville Rd/NC 115

Right on Speedway Rd/ Old US HWY 421

Speedway is 1.5 miles on the right

From I-77, Winston-Salem and points East:

Take US HWY 421 N to Exit 277

Right at top of ramp

First Left on Speedway Rd

Speedway is 3.6 miles on the left

When you enter the Speedway Property

Follow the driveways around the speedway going East (clockwise) until you reach the track entrance under the back stretch grandstands.

Turn right under the Grand Stands to enter the Speedway

COME TO A COMPLETE STOP BEFORE CROSSING TRACK SURFACE

There should be a marshal who will also have a waiver form that EVERYONE MUST SIGN before entering the Speedway

Look both ways for cyclists then proceed carefully across track into the infield

Go through both sets of gates, and turn left at the pit lane wall to proceed to the Stock Car Garage.

You may park under the Garage or behind it – IF YOU HAVE ROOF RACKS DON’T FORGET ABOUT YOUR BIKE

title: Tri Cyclists Time Trial @ Iron Gate Winery

address.street: North Meck Park, Fisher Farm Park, Renaissance Park, Col. Francis Beatty Park, USNWC

title: Boone-Roubaix: the Hell of the High Country

address.street: River Girl Fishing Company, 4041 Todd Railroad Grade Rd

description:
Boone-Roubaix, the Hell of the High Country, is America\'s next great Classic. A road race featuring over three to six miles of unpaved roads with and multiple selective climbs will test riders, while the breathtaking scenery and unmatched hospitality will combine to make for one of the most memorable races of the year.
Once again, River Girl Fishing Company will be our host. Bring your family and friends to enjoy a day on the New River fishing, tubing, paddling, or just hanging out with Petunia the Pig.
This year we are offering cash prizes for the P123 Men and Women and Master\'s races, and River Girl tubing, fishing, and paddling packages for Cat 4/5 Men and Cat 4 Women.
Once again this race will be a fundraiser for Wine-to-Water, a 501(c)(3) international aid organization focused on providing clean water to needy people around the world, and volunteers from the Appalachian State University Wine-to-Water campus group will be manning wheel trucks and acting as course marshals.
course:
Cat 4/5 Men and Women will ill be subjected to a 43 miles course with 3.1 miles of pavé in 6 sections, and 3,682 feet of climbing, including the Koppenberg of the High Country, a quarter mile, unpaved, 15% climb. 
Pro/1/2/3 and Masters’ races will use Le Grand Parcourse: 54 miles, six of pavé, and 4,565 feet of ascending including two trips up our Koppenberg.
The finish for all races is in Todd near the start and is preceded by 10 miles on Rail Road Grade road, the flattest road in region, with no unpaved sections.
registration:
Registration:
Pro/1/2 and Cat 3 Men start and finish together, but are scored and awarded separately
Pro/1/2/3 and Cat 4 Women start and finish together, but are scored and awarded separately
35+ and 45+ start and finish together, but are scored and awarded separately
Register online (processing fee applies)
Registration open 8:30-9:30 and 11:15 to 12:15. There are no refunds.
USAC License required. One-day license for Men 5 and Women 4 available for $10.
notes:
Rules:
USAC rules to govern all races.
Permit pending.
All participants must sign a waiver.
Riders must wear CPSC approved helmets and wear them at all times when riding a bicycle.
Centerline rule will be strictly enforced.
Organizer reserves right to combine or cancel fields and/or prize for fields with fewer than 10 (ten) riders
Cancellation, postponement or re-routing of course due to dangerous conditions at the discretion of USA Cycling officials, law enforcement, and the promoter.
Warnings:
Variable weather conditions leading up to or on the day of the event may result in extreme riding conditions.
We strongly advise running 25c or larger diameter tires.
Bring multiple spare tubes and flat kits.
Wheels in/wheels out, but you may wait a really long time before you see the wheel vehicle.
Walking is a distinct possibility, consider wearing MTB-style shoes.
The rider and bicycle should be in top condition before attempting this race.
Each lap contains steep, unpaved roads that may be extremely rough, covered in deep potholes and/or muddy. Each lap also contains 10 miles of very flat paved roads that may have a strong tailwind.  Choose your equipment wisely.
This race will be epic.
Don’t give up.
directions:
Come up Friday night and stay in Ashe County! There are a number of great, affordable hotels nearby in West Jefferson (closer and easier to access than Boone), and tons of cabin rentals and B&Bs on or near the course.
For information go to the Ashe County Chamber of Commerce http://www.ashechamber.com/visitor-info/accommodations or search for \"West Jefferson\" using your preferred online booking site. Be sure to tell them you are coming for the race.
Directions:
River Girl Fishing Company, 4041 Todd Railroad Grade Rd, Todd, NC 28684
From US HWY 421
North on NC-194
Follow for 11 miles
Right on Todd Railroad Grade Rd
Follow signs to parking

title: The Reynolds Blue Ridge Crits Benefiting the Mount

address.street: Main St NW & Harper Ave NW

description: One hundred kilometer races for all classes on a beautiful, rolling course through the Carolina Foothills, starting and finishing in the newly restored downtown of Lenoir, NC.
course: This is a very rural route, but unlike some, the roads are lightly trafficked and the pavement is smooth, much of it only a year old. There is no better way to test your legs early in the season than by riding underneath the mountains of Blowing Rock. There are several short Cat 5 climbs, and all followed by fun, safe descents. The route travels in and out of the valleys to the north and east of Lenoir, a 2008 All America City, beginning and ending in the renovated downtown. Temperatures in May range from 60 - 80 F. The terrain is interesting and varied. There is open farmland, densely wooded mountains, wide and narrow valleys, and many creeks flowing beside the roads. There are horse farms, tree farms, and cattle farms. The route opens up regularly to afford big views of the countryside of Caldwell and Wilkes Counties.
registration: Register online at http://pre-reg.com/Users/RacerMain.aspx?Type=1&EventID=594. Fee applies. All classes $30 before May 1, $35 through 10PM EDT Friday, May 13. On site registration $40 - open from 6:30AM to 7:30AM.
notes:
This race held under USA Cycling Permit 2011-1069.
Pro/Cat 1/2 Men and Cat 3 Men start and finish together and are scored and awarded separately.
Masters 35+ and 45+ start and finish together and are scored and awarded separately
Women Pro/Cat 1/2/3 and Women Cat 4 start and finish together and are scored and awarded separately
All participants must wear CPSC approved helmet.
Promoter reserves right to combine or cancel fields/prizes with fewer than ten (10) entries.
Held rain or shine. 
Cancellation, postponement or course changes due to dangerous conditions at discretion of the promoter, law enforcements, and USA Cycling officials.
No refunds.
directions: From US-321N go West on Harper Ave/NC-18/NC-90 and follow signs to parking. Address is Harper Ave NW & Main St NW, Lenoir, NC

title: Town Mountain Hill Climb Time Trial
Peaks Coaching Group Asheville Training Camp
High Point City Crits/NC State Criterium Champions
Powerade State Games of NC Mountain Bike Race
Magic Cycles AMBC Weekend - Southern Classic #8
description:
Three Races over two days with Omnium scoring and prizes, all part of the USA Cycling American Mountain Bike Challenge (AMBC) Series
Cross Country Race is also part of the Southern Classic Series.
Super-D Race is also part of the North Carolina Super-D Championship Series. Two runs- best time counts The top 15 qualifiers in each 5-year age bracket of each class will automatically qualify for 2011 USA Cycling Cross-Country Mountain Bike National Championships to be held at Sun Valley Resort in Ketchum, Idaho.
course:
Super-D course is approximately 1.8 miles with 800 feet of descending, on fast, flowing single track.
Short Track course is half single track descent, half grassy climb, located at the very top of Beech Mountain (5,300 feet elevation).
Cross Country course is 9 miles of rolling, rooty, tight single track, with one short section on gravel road and another under the power lines, all between 4,900 and 5,300 feet elevation, with no sustained climbs - this is NOT the old ski area course.
Cross-country course distances subject to change contingent on riding conditions - regardless of distance, target winning times are 1 hour for Cat 3, 1:30 for Cat 2, and 2 hours for Cat 1.
registration:
Pre-register on bikereg.com
Super-D $20 Cat 2&3, $25 Pro and Cat 1
Short Track $20 Cat 2&3, $25 Pro and Cat 1
Cross Country $20 Juniors, $25 Cat 3, $30 Cat 2, $35 Cat 1 and Pro
Pre-register for all three events and save $15!
Online Registration closes 11:59PM Thursday, June 16.
$5/race late fee for registering on-site
Register fo
notes:
Super-D, Short Track and Omnium scoring will combine all age groups for each category. Cross Country will use Southern Classic Series age groups. All Womens\' categories are combined for Super-D, Short Track and the Omnium. There are no Junior categories for Super-D, Short Track, or the Omnium
Cat 2 prizes include gift certificates for Cane Creek 40-series headsets, and Uvex helmets and sunglasses from Maguradirect.com
Course maps, schedules, registration, prizes, and lodging information at http://www.beechmtb.com
directions:
From Banner Elk: At the stoplight in Banner Elk, take a left. Go 1/4 mile and bear right onto 184 to Beech Mtn. Come up to the top of the mountain (about 3 miles) and turn left at the sign for Emerald Mountain.

From Atlanta: Take 85 to Spartanburg. Get off on 221N. Go all the way to Linville (not the same as Linville Falls). At the stoplight in Linville, take a left onto 105N. Go 5 miles - take a left on 184 to Banner Elk. Go 7 miles to the stoplight in Banner Elk and take a left. See above directions from Banner Elk. It is about a 5-hour trip.

From Raleigh: Take 40 W to Winston-Salem. In Winston-Salem, take 421 to N.Wilkesboro and on to Boone. At the fifth stoplight in Boone, take a left onto 105S. Go about 12 miles to 184. Take a right onto 184 to Banner Elk. See directions from Banner Elk above. It is about a 4-hour trip.

From Charlotte: There are 2 ways you can come. (1) Take I-77N to 421. Go North on 421 to N. Wilkesboro and on to Boone. At the fifth stoplight take a left onto 105S. Go about 12 miles to 184. Take a right onto 184 to Banner Elk. See above. Or, (2) take 16 to 321N in Hickory and on to Boone. At the main stoplight in Boone, take a left onto 105S. Go about 12 miles to 184. Take a right onto 184 to Banner Elk. Either way it is about a 2 1/2 to 3 hour trip.

From Asheville: Take I-40 E to Marion. In Marion get on 221 N. Go all the way to Linville (not the same as Linville Falls). At the stoplight in Linville, take a left onto 105N. Go 5 miles - take a left on 184 to Banner Elk. Go 7 miles to the stoplight in Banner Elk and take a left. See above directions from Banner Elk. It is about a 1 1/2 hour trip.

From Knoxville/\"West\": There are 2 ways you can come.
1) Paved and easy: Take 81 S to I-181 S. In Johnson City pick up US 321 to Elizabethton, TN. In Elizabethton, follow 19E across the NC line into Elk Park. In Elk Park, turn left onto 194 to Banner Elk. Go 6 and a half miles and turn left onto 184 to Beech Mtn. See above directions from Banner Elk.
2) Unpaved, twisty, steep, but more direct to camping and bottom of Super-D. Take 81 S to I-181 S. In Johnson City pick up US 321 to Elizabethton, TN. Stay on US-321 heading toward Boone. Pass Watauga Lake and take right onto US-321 at split with TN-67. Go 14.8 miles and turn right on Buckeye Rd. Go 3.7 miles and turn left to Buckeye Creek Rd. THIS ROAD IS UNPAVED. Go 2.4 miles to end. At end turn left on Grassy Gap Creek Rd. You will pass the Buckeye Recreation Center on your left, which is where camping is located (Base of Super-D is right on Pinnacle Ridge). Continue on Grassy Gap Creek Rd, which becomes Pine Ridge Rd for approximately 4 miles. Turn Left on Beech Mountain Parkway, pass ski area and Beech Mountain Town hall, and take a right at the sign for Emerald Mountain.

title: Powerade State Games of NC Criterium

High Rock Road Race - Crossroads Classic
Dark Mountain XC/Super D - SCS Series Finale
Alray Tire of Boone Cyclocross Series
description: Tuesday Nights Under the Lights! Cyclocross for the masses!
course: Bigger and better than ever, featuring the newly re-opened quarter mile dirt oval. Mostly grass course, with a mix of tight turns, fast straights, a run up, and off-camber. Perfect to get your skills sharpened, great for spectating.
registration: Season pass available online for $155 until August 22 NO FEE. Buy a pass onsite for $175. $15 for one race, $20 for two. College students and juniors $10/$15. USA Cycling road OR mtb license required, one-day license $5. Collegiate racers must have a \"normal\" road or MTB license (not just collegiate). Checks payable to Pirate Race Productions.
notes: Three monthly series plus bonus two week August \"pre-season\" with prizes from Blowing Rock Ale, Cane Creek and Panaracer for top male and female finishers in both the \"A\" and \"B\" race as well as Capo leaders jerseys awarded every month.
directions:

Travel 3/4 of a mile to Roby Greene Road and take a left

Right at light on Old US HWY 421 before electric billboard
Travel one mile to Roby Greene Road and take a right
see below:

From Roby Greene Road:
After less than a quarter mile, you will see a huge lumberyard on your left
The left-hand entrance into Fairgrounds is only about 100 yards beyond the lumberyard. If you come to the end of the pavement you\'ve gone too far.
Follow the driveway onto the property, bearing left.
Drive slowly and be careful of cyclists warming up and racing across the driveway!
Parking is in the field ahead and to your right.
NEW REGISTRATION LOCATION
Registration is located at the Speedway booth under the stands uphill past the trees.

title: Brenner Pro-Am Race - Fighting Childhood Obesity
Cyclocross Skills Clinic and Women's-Only Clinic
description: Two clinics at one location: a cyclocross skills clinic open to all, and our second annual Womens\' Only CX Clinic featuring National Champion Ashley James
course: Clinics will be held at separate parts of the Boone Fairgrounds, so each group can practice skills including starts, cornering, barriers, run ups, and more, as well as pointers on training, nutrition, bike setup, pre-race rituals and more from some of the best cyclocross racers in the Southeast
registration: Register at http://www.bikereg.com/events/register.asp?eventid=14047 $40 before Sept 1, $50 until noon Sept 10, $60 day of.

If you come to the end of the pavement you\'ve gone too far. Follow the driveway onto the property, bearing left. Drive slowly and be careful of cyclists warming up and racing across the driveway! title: 2011 Dirty Wolf
description: XC and Short track events to be expected
course: Technical NC single track with roots and flowy sections abound.
registration: Needs to be done before event, will allow 45 minutes before start.

title: 2011 USA Cycling Gravity Mountain Bike Nationals
Appalachian State MTB Race Weekend
description: ASU home race weekend as a part of the ACC mountain bike season. Come race amazing trails in the beautiful blue ridge mountains! Saturday will be held on Beech Mountain and feature cross country and short track. Sunday will be held at the new Rocky Knob Park just 3 miles from ASU campus in Boone NC and feature an individual time trial and a blazing fast super d.
course:
XC and Short Track will be held on the Emerald Outback trails of Beech Mtn. Expect fun and flowy trails with a mixture of fire road climbs, rooty sections and extended descents thrown for good measure. Short Track will feature a mix of singletrack and open grassy fields to facilitate passing.

Sunday at Rocky Knob Park is sure to impress. The individual time trial features a tempo climb from the parking lot and then descends its way back down on a no brakes rush to the finish line. The Super D will start on the highest trail at the park and descend with minimal climbing to the bottom. 2.5 miles of buffed and bermed trail with lots of line choice for those who like to push it.
directions:
Parking For Saturday will be located at the intersection of Beech Mountain Parkway and Oz Road Banner Elk NC 28604. Parking is at the Emerald Outback Trailhead on the right side of the road. If you pass the Town Hall on your left you have gone too far.

Rocky Knob Park is located on US 421 approx 1/4 of a mile past the Nissan dealership on the right side of the road if you are coming from Boone.

title: Wilkesboro Cyclocross
description: Gravel roadbeds, grass, piney woods across hilly terrain at a pristine campground - Indoor bathrooms, showers, infinite bike washes - Day after Kingsport UCI (about a two hour drive)
registration: Online at Pre-Reg.com. Day of additional $10 all classes except Junior categories. There is a one time race fee of $5.00 for your number (except MTB category). This fee is paid at the first series race you participate in.  This number is to be used at all races. Please do not lose it. Additional races are $5.00. Pay the higher entry fee and get the discount on the lower entry. *MTB category not part of NCCX - no number fee.
directions: 700 Snyder Street, Wilkesboro, NC 28697 -- FROM KINGSPORT UCI  -- Head south on I-26 E for 21 miles to US-321/TN-67 toward Elizabethton. After 4.5 miles turn Right on TN-362 S/TN-67 E, then turn right onto Gap Creek Rd. At end turn right onto TN-37 S/US-19E S. Follow for 17 miles then turn left onto N Carolina 194 N. Follow into Banner Elk and turn right at light onto N Carolina 184. At end turn left onto N Carolina 105 N. Follow into Boone to end, then turn right onto US-421 S. and go 31 miles.Take 421 South to Brushy Mountain Rd exit. At end of ramp, turn left toward Amoco Gas Station. Go approx. 1 mile until you reach the first stoplight.  Turn right and go about 1/2 mile. Race is located on the first road to left (Snyder Street) after you cross the Bridge. See below “From Snyder St.” -- FROM BOONE, NC-16,  NC-18 N OR NC-268 E -- Take 421 South to Brushy Mountain Rd exit. At end of ramp, turn left toward Amoco Gas Station. Go approx. 1 mile until you reach the first stoplight.  Turn right and go about 1/2 mile. Race is located on the first road to left (Snyder Street) after you cross the Bridge. See below “From Snyder St.” -- FROM GREENSBORO -- Take I-40 West to 421 North in Winston-Salem go about 50 miles to Brushy Mountain Rd Exit. At end of exit ramp, turn right toward Amoco Gas Station. Go to first light and turn RIGHT. Go about 1/2 mile.  Race is located on the first road on left (Snyder Street) after you cross the Bridge. See below “From Snyder St.” -- FROM I-77 -- Take Exit 73-B 421 North (toward North Wilkesboro) Go 19 miles until you reach Brushy Mountain Rd Exit. At the end of the exit ramp, turn right going toward Amoco Gas Station. Go approx. 1 mile until you reach first stoplight. Turn right and go about 1/2 mile. Race is located on the first road on left (Snyder Street) after you cross the Bridge. See below “From Snyder St.” -- FROM SNYDER ST -- go straight up hill through white gate, past brick building on left. Take right on Tom’s Roost, up steep gravel road. Park in field adjacent to bath house on left. Start/Finish is at the top of that road.
